title: Frequently {{gradient:Asked Questions}}
subtitle: Find clear answers about our services, process, and technology stack.

faqs.question: How long does it take to develop a web application?
faqs.answer: It depends on the scope. A basic app can take 4–6 weeks, while more complex platforms may require 3–6 months. In our initial consultation, we’ll provide a clear timeline tailored to your project.

faqs.question: Do you provide ongoing support after launch?
faqs.answer: Yes. We offer support and maintenance plans that include bug fixes, security updates, performance improvements, and feature enhancements.

faqs.question: What technologies do you use for development?
faqs.answer: We work with modern technologies like React, Node.js, TypeScript, Python, and various cloud services. Our stack is selected based on your specific needs for speed, security, and scalability.

faqs.question: Can you help migrate an existing application?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We specialize in migrating legacy systems to modern platforms. Our phased approach ensures a smooth transition with minimal disruption.

faqs.question: How do you handle changes or new requirements?
faqs.answer: We follow an agile methodology, which allows us to adapt quickly. When changes arise, we assess their impact and work with you to reprioritize and adjust the scope if needed.

faqs.question: What makes your development approach different?
faqs.answer: We go beyond code—we partner with you to understand your business goals and user needs. Our approach combines technical expertise with strategic insight, transparent communication, and quality-first execution.
